content:
The document describes built-in global variables provided by the ShowBase class in Panda3D applications, explaining their purposes and usage. The chunk situates within this list, detailing additional variables including those for accessing distribution info, inspecting objects, deprecated config access, and a legacy task loop function.

**Context:**

The chunk is part of a comprehensive list outlining global variables available in Panda3D when using ShowBase, each serving specific functionalities like system information, object inspection tools, deprecated interfaces, and legacy task management.

Provides information about the Panda3D distribution, such as the version, compiler information and build settings. Short-hand for PandaSystem.getGlobalPtr() <panda3d.core.PandaSystem.getGlobalPtr>.

Short-hand for direct.tkpanels.Inspector.inspect(), which opens up a GUI panel for inspecting an object's properties.

See inspection-utilities.

The deprecated ~direct.showbase.DConfig interface for accessing config variables <accessing-config-vars-in-a-program>.

Calls the task manager main loop, which runs indefinitely. This is a deprecated short-hand for base.run() <direct.showbase.ShowBase.ShowBase.run>.

See main-loop.
